intro: Distrianthes molliflora, commonly known as the soft-flowered distrianthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
